content.body: I think you get a navigate event with a null destination but need to double-check

anyway cross-origin traverses are likely the least interesting use-cases for route-matching... as you can't style anything related to the new route and also can't style links to the route as the back button is not a link, and also the navigation is likely instant because of BFCache

ok we only send them for same-origin traverse:
https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#preventing-navigation:fire-a-traverse-navigate-event
so you also won't be notified of the route change here or of it being a navigation at all... it's like a "close"
https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40892121

That's why `Report` doesn't have an interface object exposed in window:
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/report.idl;l=8;bpv=1;bpt=0
content.formatted_body:
That's why Report doesn't have an interface object exposed in window:
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/report.idl;l=8;bpv=1;bpt=0
